posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
This is as much for my education as anything, but I hope the responses might be instructive for others too.

I've just read in another thread the sentence "I like gnomes." Now, that stands perfectly well on its own, but this was in the context of Wiz/Rog builds. Which does, of course, make sense. However, it got me thinking (always dangerous for us infantry types) about the lack of Gnome builds - in both Hip's ECB Filter and the Archive, gnome is the least represented race by a country mile. Why is that, do we think?

Admittedly, there's a clear role preference given for gnomes at creation, but the same is true of most other races. Is it simply less adaptable than the others, regardless of their own restrictions/penalties? Or is there something particular about the big-noses we struggle with?

Yours, hoping for clarity, Stag

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
I'm assuming it's the 1 less feat, less skills and lack of versatility for favored class that repels many builder/players.  Wiz/rog has no other issues, but when adding a tertiary (maybe like fighter for a spellsword), there's the XP penalty to consider.

I like the extra HP, conc success & Fort save in a class that is typically lacking in those areas.  The extra AC also doesn't hurt the cause.

Maybe it's just not a familiar roleplay race.  Dwarves, half-orc and elf are fairly straightforward lorewise, but gnomes... how exactly would you expect others to interact with those folks?   Stare down in wonder, mostly I suspect.

Don't get too shocked, but the main reason I like them is that when there is a hallway packed with waiting foes, my gnome can slip between them easier while undetected, either via invis or GS.  Much better at recon and preemptive trap control that way.  But in my case, the preference is based on playstyle.

When's the last time YOU played a gnome?  There's your answer.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Interesting - thanks, Hip. Absolutely get what you say about gnome-lore - any Scandinavians out there who might like to help?

You know I haven't done caster stuff at all (I don't count Bard song) - it's all too complicated for a bear with very little brain - so Gnome was never likely to be my first choice of race. But you have me thinking again. From a selfish perspective, I wonder if a Gnome Wiz/Monk/Rogue might be a runner - using Monk more for defensive purposes (more balanced saves, naturally improving speed and AC, various immunities and so on) than I have before. I appreciate there will be a trade-off in terms of number of levels taken, but it might be a good way for me to start experimenting with this magic malarkey as well. (Although I can't help but love the idea of a Gnome berserker.)

And I'll get more turnips, too!

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Stagmeister wrote:
From a selfish perspective, I wonder if a Gnome Wiz/Monk/Rogue might be a runner - using Monk more for defensive purposes (more balanced saves, naturally improving speed and AC, various immunities and so on) than I have before.
...
And I'll get more turnips, too!
Turnips are supposed to be good as an underarm deodorant (probably because as soon as you lift either arm, they fall out and alert everyone to your presence *lol*).  Maybe there's a hidden racial agenda in that fact.  There may be a definite reason why they are often loners.

There's that treacherous tertiary syndrome waiting for you.  As long as you can keep monk and rogue levels close, the possibility of periodic Discipline dumps are at least worth consideration.  Then there is that wiz/rog/HS so you can refine your rogue skills better and faster.  Just like most prestige, there is a cost but at least wouldn't need many levels.  HS would probably be best to take in epic, though.  There's some free DEX AC waiting there.  I always figure on at least caster 24 but more means better spell penetration and slots.  Decisions, decisions.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Ah, the gods crap on my strawberries yet again (makes them grow, but they're not terribly tasty - unless you like that kind of thing) as far as initial thoughts go. In fact, it would severely cramp both Monk and Rogue by not allowing either to reach the minimum of what I'd like (although I suppose M6/Rog10 might just about work, just with xp penalties). Five levels in HS would actually allow for up to 11 in Rog (I'll simply take your word that at least 24 levels of caster should be taken as a given, 'cos you've been right on lots of other things), although I do see what you say about spell pen -

Hold on, I meant this to be theoretical - as far as I was concerned, anyway! I'm now actively interested in building/playing a caster - and the toon's name suddenly appears in my head, in your honour...Bat Rastard!

But seriously, thanks, Hip.

posts.author: hunearo
posts.content:
Stagmeister wrote:
in both Hip's ECB Filter and the Archive, gnome is the least represented race by a country mile
I just didn't believe that half-elf could be a more popular choice than anything, so I did a quick search... it is roughly the same as the gnome :)
However I'm not surprised. Half-elf merges the crappiest bonuses of the human and the elf... half-elf is a race for role-playing, not powergaming, in almost every cases one of his parent is a better choice. More than half of the half-elf builds is an AA build with two non-wiz base classes, so they avoid the exp penalty, but thats all.

The gnome's case is something similair. There is a better choice for almost every build. If you want his +CON in melee, go with a dwarf, for a sneaky small build the halfling is better, and usually elf makes a better wiz I think.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Oh, I'm enjoying this - suddenly we have gnomes popping up everywhere - I'm starting to think you've all just been keeping them locked in the basement as the family secret!

I certainly like the principles (and indeed the picture in my mind's eye) underpinning hunearo's WM gnome. I'd do it differently, but I'm no great shakes at WM builds, so not better, just differently. Mick's Rotor is, as ever, fascinating. And I'm enjoying looking at the ongoing discussion in the Unfinalized forum too - and learning stuff as well, so many thanks, one and all.

In a way, I'm now seeing gnomes more as idiot savants - gifted, but obsessed with the minor details (Dustin Hoffman in Rain Man, effectively). Which of course reinforces Hip's original Wiz/Rog thinking. And yet also with the potential for immense crossness and raging. All good stuff. As hunearo hints at, it seems like an excellent RP choice, but perhaps not the best for power builds, except in very particular ways.

Alas, before I turn my sagging intellect to trying to come up with a caster-gnome, I have unfinished business with two or three builds I need to finalize, so I'll be getting on with testing them first. And then you can start laughing about one that emanates for here. Thank you all.

Oh, and as far as Half-Elves are concerned, apologies: I'd forgotten to even search for them (which says something in itself), so thanks for picking me up on that, hunearo - and big plusses for using the filter, too!
